attributes.action: De-Nationalise and cease all public funding of the BBC
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The BBC spends £54 million on its top-earning stars, according to new figures. 
The figure accounts for 1.55% of the £3.6 billion annual licence fee income and is paid to artists, presenters, musicians and other contributors earning £150,000 and more. 
£115 million was spent on those earning up to £50,000, £44 million on those earning between £50,000 and £100,000 and £16 million on the £100,000 to £150,000 bracket. 
This sheer waste of the licence-payers hard-earned cash must stop NOW!!!!
The BBC is a luxury that our country can no longer afford to subsidise. It must me FORCED to pay for itself.The licence-payer should have more say in the running of this over-subsidised,"fat-cats" regime.
The BBC already show "advertisements" of their own programs and presenters.
I do not see the difference between advertising their own programs and advertising products in the case of commercial television.
The BBC should be reformed as a Limited Company able to maintain its own funding by the use of commercial advertising and the global marketing of its programs.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
